simacogo

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • simacogo.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PrintGame

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents a Game of Simicogo.
    Author:
    Patrick Drucker

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Creates a Game with a Human and Computer player.
      Game(int numPlies)
      Creates a Game with a Human and Computer player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Creates a Game with a Human and Computer player. Initializes Human to player0 and Computer to player1. Doesn't initialize numPlies.

      • Game

        public Game(int numPlies)
        Creates a Game with a Human and Computer player. Initializes Human to player0 and Computer to player1.
        Parameters:
        numPlies - the number of plies that the computer should search through (depth of minimax algorithm)

    • Method Detail

      • getFirstMovePiece

        public static char getFirstMovePiece()
        Returns:
        pieces[0] the piece of the Player that will move first (Human)

      • getPieces

        Returns:
        pieces

      • getPlayers

        public Player[] getPlayers()
        Returns:
        players

      • getHumanPlayer

        public static Player getHumanPlayer()
        Returns:
        players[0] the human player

      • getComputerPlayer

        public static Player getComputerPlayer()
        Returns:
        players[1] the computer player

      • getNumPlies

        public static int getNumPlies()
        Returns:
        numPlies

      • takeTurnHuman

        public void takeTurnHuman(Player player,
                          int columnNumber)
        Sets the currentState to where the Human Player chooses to drop a piece.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player who is taking this turn (human)
        columnNumber - the column where a piece will be dropped

      • takeTurnComputer

        public void takeTurnComputer(Player player)
        Sets the currentState to where the Computer chooses to drop a piece.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player who is taking this turn (computer)

      • getCurrentState

        Returns:
        currentState
